intro: Stenandrium andrei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of small, brightly colored blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth. Stenandrium andrei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
